channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large flytip Northfield Road opposite junction with Chester Gardens, 21st June
item.description:
Usual place beside the green BT junction box. Large pile of junk on pavement. Please clear as it encourages further dumping and brings down the tone of the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Northfield Road, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On Plympton Avenue, 21st June
item.description:
The tree is causing problems outside my kitchen window as it’s making it difficult with the hot weather to open my window as well as dropping buds into my kitchen and bathroom staining worktops & the bath

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Torbay Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction - Overgrown / overhanging private tree / hedge

item.title: Roadside Memorial – Cleanup Needed, 21st June
item.description:
Unfortunately a person died in Feb 2025 but it’s long past the time to remove the memorial. It’s a blight on the park with piles of dead flowers in plastic packaging. Its not fair for residents to see it everyday.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lea Bridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: The road works on Thames Road near the railway bridge, 21st June
item.description:
FYI, I noticed on Friday evening about 19:30 when driving through the roadworks that two lads had taken a palet and some lengths of supporting wood from the area that is been worked at Not sure if you have CCTV in the area?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Thames Road, Barnes Cray, London

item.title: Robert Street corner adjacent to Albany Street NW1, 21st June
item.description:
This is so dangerous for road traffic and people tossing the street, there’s no room on the pavement overflowing with Lime bikes! Please get rid of these bikes - they are a nuisance causing obstructions to road users and dangerous!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-30, Robert Street, Fitzrovia, London

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Faded Road Markings and Parking Bays, 21st June
item.description:
Busy road, so road markings are faded, the contractors seem to have covered bus stop markings but not the markings for road divider, parking bays, throughout Mansfield Rd, post Estelle Rd junction. It would be great to also have a 20MPH, School Zone marking to repeatedly remind motorists to not overspeed here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mansfield Road, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Filthy Pavements at Gospel Oak Station and Bridge, 21st June
item.description:
The pavement near the station, and overall cleanliness is extremely poor. Photo 1: Under the rail bridge, the passage is already too narrow for the pedestrian traffic, and there is a water leak that has been around for 2 years and not fixed. There's pooling of water during rains here. Photo 2: The rubbish bin is always overfull not able to cater for visitors to the heath, the GO station covering multiple lines, and local residents. Suggest more frequent cleaning collection here; Photo 2: The pavement is so dirty and has marks which need deep-cleaning to keep up the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gordon House Road, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Bike turned up first and dumping of bags have happened after …

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Penge, London

item.title: 5 abandoned bikes, 21st June
item.description:
Five bikes abandoned across the whole of a very wide public pedestrian walkway. This is unacceptable. Get rid of them now. Too many bikes to even take photos of their unique reference codes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 123, Stamford Street, Waterloo, London
